text: George Rieveschl (January 9, 1916 â€“ September 27, 2007) was an American chemist and professor. He invented the antihistamine diphenhydramine (Benadryl), which he first made when trying to make a drug like scopolamine. ==References== Category:1916 births Category:2007 deaths Category:American chemists Category:Academics from Ohio
